ğŸ¨ STYLE GUIDE CONSISTENCY

Establish and Maintain:

VOICE: First-person memoir with technical authority

  • âœ… â€œI discoveredâ€ not â€œOne discoversâ€
  • âœ… â€œWe builtâ€ not â€œThe system was builtâ€
  • âŒ Avoid â€œyou shouldâ€ - use â€œI learned toâ€

TENSE: Past tense for stories, present for principles

  • âœ… â€œI opened the terminalâ€ (story)
  • âœ… â€œContext compoundsâ€ (principle)
  • âŒ Not â€œI am openingâ€ or â€œContext compoundedâ€

TECHNICAL DEPTH: Show code but explain impact

GOOD:
"This simple change cut our costs by 93%:
[code]
The cache check meant 2/3 of requests cost nothing."

BAD:
"We implemented caching.
[20 lines of code with no explanation]"

  5. Show the actual logs: Real DEVLOG entries with timestamps

ğŸ“ SAMPLE EDIT (To Show Style)

BEFORE:

â€œThe AI had generated iOS deployment configs for Android. It had hardcoded development URLs in production builds. It had forgotten to handle offline state.â€

AFTER:

â€œThe deployment was a masterclass in AI confusion. The iOS config referenced â€˜android:minSdkVersionâ€™. Production builds pointed to â€˜localhost:3000â€™. The offline handler? It showed a cheerful â€˜TODO: implement offline modeâ€™ comment. Three hours of cleanup for 35 minutes of generationâ€”still a net win, but barely.â€

WHY THIS WORKS:

  • Specific details (android:minSdkVersion)
  • Humor (cheerful TODO)
  • Quantified (3 hours vs 35 minutes)
  • Honest assessment (barely a win)
